flixel.atlas.FlxAtlas

type
class
Atlas class

Constructor

new(name : String, width : Int, height : Int, ?borderX : Int, ?borderY : Int)
parameters
width atlas width
height atlas height
borderX horizontal distance between nodes
borderY vertical distance between nodes
Atlas constructor

Instance Variables

atlasBitmapData : flash.display.BitmapData

borderX(default,null) : Int

Offsets between nodes in atlas

borderY(default,null) : Int

height(accessor,null) : Int

Total height of atlas

name : String

nodes : Map<String, FlxNode>

root : FlxNode

Root node of atlas

width(accessor,null) : Int

Total width of atlas

Instance Methods

addNode(Graphic : Dynamic, ?Key : String) : FlxNode

parameters
data image to store
key image name
returns
added node
Simply adds new node to atlas.

addNodes(bitmaps : Array<flash.display.BitmapData>, keys : Array<String>) : Bool

parameters
bitmaps BitmapData's to insert
keys Names of these bitmapData's
returns
true if ALL nodes were added successfully.
Optimized version of method for adding multiple nodes to atlas. Uses less atlas' area

addToQueue(data : flash.display.BitmapData, key : String) : Void

parameters
data bitmapData to hold
key "name" of bitmapData
Adds new object to queue for later creation of new node

clear() : Void

Clears all data in atlas. Use it when you want reuse this atlas

createQueue() : Void

Creates new "queue" for adding new nodes

destroy() : Void

Destroys atlas. Use only if you want to clear memory and don't need this atlas anymore

generateAtlasFromQueue() : Void

Adds all objects in "queue" to existing atlas. Doesn't erase any node

getNode(key : String) : FlxNode

parameters
key node name to search
returns
node with searched name. Null if atlas doesn't contain node with a such name
Gets node by it's name

getRegionFor(nodeName : String) : flixel.util.loaders.TextureRegion

parameters
nodeName name of the node to generate TextureRegion object for
returns
Generated TextureRegion
Generates TextureRegion object for node with specified name

getTextureData() : flixel.util.loaders.TexturePackerData

returns
TexturePackerData for this atlas
Generates TexturePackerData object for this atlas. Where each frame represents one of the inserted images

hasNodeWithName(nodeName : String) : Bool

parameters
nodeName node name to check
returns
true if atlas already contains node with the name
Checks if atlas already contains node with the same name
